snippet: The European aerospace giants, EADS and BAE Systems, said Wednesday they had failed to win government support for a merger that would have created an entity with a combined market value of about $50 billion.
abstract: The European aerospace giants, EADS and BAE Systems, said Wednesday they had failed to win government support for a merger that would have created an entity with a combined market value of about $50 billion.

byline.original: By MARK SCOTT and NICOLA CLARK

headline.main: BAE  and EADS  Merger Talks Disintegrate

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: European Aeronautic Defense and Space Co
